name: CMMC
description: CMMC 2.0 ensures that Defense Industrial Base (DIB) companies implement cybersecurity practices to protect Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) and Federal Contract Information (FCI). It aligns directly with NIST SP 800-171 requirements and adds third-party certification for Level 2 contractors. CMMC is a pass/fail requirement for DoD contracts.

certificationDetails.assessor: Level 1: Self-assessment; Level 2: C3PAO (CMMC Third-Party Assessment Organization); Level 3: DIBCAC (Government-led)

lifecycle.name: Scoping and Gap Assessment
lifecycle.description: Define CUI/FCI boundaries. Identify which CMMC level is required. Perform gap assessment against controls.

lifecycle.name: SSP and POA&M Development
lifecycle.description: Develop System Security Plan (SSP) documenting security architecture and controls. Create POA&M for open items.

lifecycle.name: Control Implementation
lifecycle.description: Implement all required controls. Evidence collection. Staff training. Process documentation.

lifecycle.name: Assessment and Certification
lifecycle.description: Engage C3PAO (Level 2) or DIBCAC (Level 3) for formal assessment. Achieve certification.

lifecycle.name: Continuous Compliance
lifecycle.description: Maintain certification through continuous monitoring, annual affirmations, and triennial reassessment.

domains.name: Access Control (AC)
domains.description: Limit system access to authorized users, processes, and devices.

controls.name: Authorized Access Control
controls.description: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement access control lists. Enforce need-to-know. Use directory services for centralized access management. Remove access upon separation.

controls.name: Transaction and Function Control
controls.description: Limit information system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement RBAC. Define function-level permissions. Enforce least privilege for all transactions.

controls.name: Least Privilege
controls.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.
controls.implementationGuidance: Restrict admin access. Use separate admin accounts. Implement just-in-time access. Audit privileged access regularly.

controls.name: Privileged Function Prevention
controls.description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions and audit the execution of such functions.
controls.implementationGuidance: Enforce separation between privileged and non-privileged operations. Audit all privileged function executions. Alert on anomalies.

controls.name: Remote Access Control
controls.description: Monitor and control remote access sessions.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement VPN with MFA. Monitor remote sessions. Log remote access. Restrict remote access to authorized users only.

domains.name: Identification and Authentication (IA)
domains.description: Identify and authenticate users, processes, and devices.

controls.name: Identification
controls.description: Identify information system users, processes acting on behalf of users, or devices.
controls.implementationGuidance: Assign unique identifiers to all users and devices. Implement device certificates. Prohibit shared accounts.

controls.name: Multi-Factor Authentication
controls.description: Use multifactor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy MFA for all privileged access. Deploy MFA for network access to non-privileged accounts. Use phishing-resistant methods (FIDO2) where possible.
evidenceRequired: Coverage report showing all required accounts

controls.name: Password Complexity
controls.description: Enforce a minimum password complexity and change of characters when new passwords are created.
controls.implementationGuidance: Enforce minimum 14 characters. Require complexity (upper, lower, numbers, special). Screen against breach databases. Implement password managers.

controls.name: Cryptographically-Protected Passwords
controls.description: Store and transmit only cryptographically-protected passwords.
controls.implementationGuidance: Hash passwords with bcrypt, scrypt, or Argon2. Never store plaintext. Transmit over TLS only. Implement proper salting.

domains.name: Audit and Accountability (AU)
domains.description: Create, protect, and retain audit records. Enable monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting.

controls.name: System Auditing
controls.description: Create and retain system audit logs and records to the extent needed to enable monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting.
controls.implementationGuidance: Log authentication events, access to CUI, administrative actions, and system changes. Include timestamp, source, user, event type, outcome.

controls.name: Actionable Audit
controls.description: Ensure that the actions of individual system users can be uniquely traced to those users so they can be held accountable.
controls.implementationGuidance: Map all audit events to individual users. Prohibit shared accounts. Implement non-repudiation. Enable forensic investigation.

controls.name: Audit Failure Alerting
controls.description: Alert in the event of an audit logging process failure.
controls.implementationGuidance: Monitor audit logging processes. Alert on failures. Implement redundant logging. Escalate audit failures as high-severity events.

controls.name: Audit Protection
controls.description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
controls.implementationGuidance: Restrict access to audit logs to authorized personnel. Implement log integrity checks. Use WORM storage. Forward to tamper-proof SIEM.

domains.name: System and Communications Protection (SC)
domains.description: Monitor, control, and protect communications at system boundaries.

controls.name: Boundary Protection
controls.description: Monitor, control, and protect organizational communications at external and key internal boundaries.
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy firewalls at all boundaries. Implement DMZ for public-facing services. Segment CUI environments. Monitor boundary traffic.

controls.name: CUI Encryption in Transit
controls.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission.
controls.implementationGuidance: Enforce TLS 1.2+ for all CUI transmission. Use VPN for network-level encryption. Disable deprecated protocols (SSLv3, TLS 1.0/1.1).

controls.name: CUI Encryption at Rest
controls.description: Employ FIPS-validated cryptography when used to protect the confidentiality of CUI.
controls.implementationGuidance: Use FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic modules. Encrypt all CUI at rest. Implement key management per NIST SP 800-57.

breachNotification.timeframe: 72 hours to DoD via DIBNet portal
breachNotification.threshold: Any cyber incident affecting DoD information or the covered contractor information system
